subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Better.
author: Lisby
full_text:
Nelly is right, buddy.  You go easy on yourself. :)

Ann

On Feb 26, 2008, at 7:00 AM, rednellie wrote:

> Frank Sumption wrote:
> > The fact is, there are other methods that work as well, and probably
>  > better. Often the voices are much clearer with the simple methods,
>  > and they can be shared since most can hear them. I am endlessly
>  > discouraged when I think I have a perfectly clear voice from the  
> box,
>  > and not another person in the world can hear it.
>
> That's just the curse of being psychic. It's hard to self monitor  
> your progress before presenting it publicly when your perception is  
> different than most other people's.  But even being able to hear  
> message clearly yourself is a step in the right direction.  I know  
> that's something I couldn't have done myself 10 years ago.
>
> Don't think you're just spinning your wheels when the experiments  
> don't work out right, though.  We all learn from the failed  
> experiments as well as the ones that worked right.  It all goes to  
> help in the long run.  There are other benefits as well.  Frank's  
> Box has been helpful to the research in that it alone has created a  
> buzz in the paranormal community that has drawn in a lot more  
> researchers .  I don't remember hearing that kind of excitement  
> about EVP Maker despite how impressive the results from that have  
> been. I'm pretty sure that you are doing what you are meant to be  
> doing in all this, even if you aren't making the kind of progress  
> you'd like.
>
>
> Nellie
>
>
